name: Overrated Movies Online Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'To Kill A Mockingbird'. Who had a cameo appearance at the end?
questions.explanation:
Robert Duvall.

	This is considered to be one of the greatest of American films. Yet, those kids are annoying ... and Duvall at the end - I don't see what makes it so special.

questions.text: 'Terms of Endearment'. Who was the star?
questions.explanation:
Shirley Maclaine.

	A solid 75 minutes of dull opening, with Nicholson and Maclaine doing their off-the wall characters. Then, because someone becomes ill, it somehow gets to be a 'classic' tear-jerker? I don't think so. (speaking of Maclaine, I might also mention 'Turning Point'.)

questions.text: 'Touch of Evil'. The first name that comes to mind is Orson Welles, but who was the leading man in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	I don't see anything outstanding or extraordinary here. (Or in 'The Third Man'.)

questions.text: 'Ryan's Daughter'. Who played the title role?
questions.explanation:
Sarah Miles.

	Yes, it's a sweeping David Lean panorama ... but this is a long, slow movie that doesn't go anywhere.

questions.text: 'Murder on the Orient Express'. Who played the victim?
questions.explanation:
Richard Widmark.

	Comic book characters - and a ludicrous ending.

Matt Damon.

	Does a long opening of blood-and-guts make a movie great? I don't think so. Other than that, a routine movie.

questions.text: 'The Last Tango in Paris'. The star?
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando.

	'Erotic masterpiece'? No, just dull. (Speaking of Brando, how about 'A Streetcar Named Desire'?)

questions.text: 'The Crying Game'. What did the movie's 'big surprise' involve?
questions.explanation:
Sex.

	On all the 'ten best' lists for its year. Why? Critics liked it - did anyone else? (On the subject of foreign movies, I might also toss in 'Blow-Up' and 'Juliet of the Spirits'.)

questions.text: 'Bus Stop'. A star-making vehicle for what actress?

questions.explanation:
Sam Peckinpah.

	Tough sledding. (I also considered 'Americanization of Emily' and 'Anatomy of a Murder' for this last spot.)
